summary: Core weather search, selection, fetching via React Query, and contextual advice appear implemented. However, the first-load UX shows an empty-state screen with a button rather than immediately showing a location input form as required. The diff also adds Internet Identity/auth and actor-related hooks that were not requested in the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: On first load, the app shows a location input form (no automatic geolocation).
missing_requirements.reason: The initial render shows an EmptyState with a hero image and a “Search Location” button; the actual location input form (LocationSearch) is only shown after the user clicks to start search (showSearch state).

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication provider and related identity/login state management
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly lists user accounts/authentication flows as non-goals (beyond template defaults), but the diff adds substantial Internet Identity provider logic and wiring in the app entry.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend actor creation hook and actor query invalidation logic (useActor) implying backend interaction patterns beyond the weather UI requirements
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on a client-side weather lookup flow using public APIs; adding actor instantiation/query invalidation is not requested by any requirement.
